page.title: 10CUSTOMS
page.content: {St.Day Feast}is a religious festival. It honours a saint who gave his name to{St.Day.}He was a bishop from Brittany who visited{St.Day}to convert the people.It is not known what dates he was here(if he was here) but he died in 680A.D.{St.Day feast}is always 3 weeks after Whitsun.In 1928 the playing field was opened and the children were given a saffron bun and 1p.The old people had a mug of tea.In 1930 Mr.W.J.Mills an old {St.Day {resident}invested Â£ 2,200,the interest from which was to provide a saffron bun and 5 pence to all the children and tea for the old people on {Feast {Monday.}The old people have a present at Christmas.This is still done today but from this year the children will receive 50 pence.In the week before the{Feast,}there are many things going on.
